'''Flareon''' ([[List of Japanese Pokémon names|Japanese]]: '''ブースター''' ''Booster'') is a {{type|Fire}} {{OBP|Pokémon|species}} introduced in [[Generation I]].

It [[Evolution|evolves]] from {{p|Eevee}} when exposed to a [[Fire Stone]]. It is one of Eevee's [[Eeveelution|final forms]], the others being {{p|Vaporeon}}, {{p|Jolteon}}, {{p|Espeon}}, {{p|Umbreon}}, {{p|Leafeon}}, {{p|Glaceon}}, and {{p|Sylveon}}.

==Biology==
Flareon is a mammalian, quadruped Pokémon covered in short, reddish-orange fur. It has long ears, dark eyes, and a small black nose. There are three small toes and a yellow paw pad on each foot. Fluffy yellow fur forms a small tuft on its head, as well as its bushy tail and a mane around its chest and neck. It will fluff out its collar to cool down its high body temperature. This high temperature is caused by its internal flame sac. Flareon stores and heats inhaled air in this sac, and then exhales it as fire. Flareon is mostly found in {{DL|List of Pokémon by habitat|Urban Pokémon|populated areas}}, and is rarely seen in the wilderness.

==In the anime==
[[File:Virgil Flareon.png|thumb|250px|left|Flareon in the {{pkmn|anime}}]]
===Major appearances===
Flareon debuted in ''[[EP040|The Battling Eevee Brothers]]'', under the ownership of {{DL|Eevee brothers|Pyro}}.

{{Ash}} {{pkmn|battle}}d against a Flareon during the [[Pokémon League]] Entrance Exam in ''[[EP056|The Ultimate Test]]''.

A Flareon appeared in ''[[EP183|Trouble's Brewing]]'' and ''[[EP226|Espeon, Not Included]]'', under the ownership of one of the [[Kimono Girl|Kimono Sisters]].

A {{type|Fire}} Pokémon Trainer named [[Egan]] used a Flareon to capture a {{p|Magcargo}} in ''[[EP240|Some Like it Hot]]''.

[[Savannah]] has a Flareon, which debuted in ''[[AG077|A Fan with a Plan]]''. It was used in the first round of the [[Rubello Town]] [[Pokémon Contest]] in ''[[AG078|Cruisin' for a Losin']]''.

A Flareon appeared in ''[[DP174|Last Call — First Round!]]'', under the ownership of [[Ursula]]. It evolved from {{p|Eevee}} during the [[Appeal|Performance Stage]] of the [[Sinnoh Grand Festival]]. It reappeared in ''[[DP175|Opposites Interact!]]'', where it was used along with {{TP|Ursula|Gabite}} in a [[Double Battle|two-on-two]] [[Contest Battle]] against {{an|Dawn}}; it went up against against {{TP|Dawn|Pachirisu}} and {{TP|Dawn|Mamoswine}}.

A Flareon appeared in ''[[BW102|Team Eevee and the Pokémon Rescue Squad!]]'', along with an Eevee and its other evolutions, under the ownership of [[Virgil]].

A Flareon appeared in ''[[BW135|Mystery on a Deserted Island!]]'', where it evolved from one of three {{p|Eevee}}.

A Flareon appeared in ''[[PK25|Eevee & Friends]]'' with an {{p|Eevee}} and its other evolutions, including the newly introduced {{p|Sylveon}}.

===Minor appearances===
A {{pkmn|Trainer}}'s Flareon appeared in ''[[EP073|Bad to the Bone]]''.

A Flareon was among the Pokémon controlled by [[Cassidy]] and [[Butch]] in ''[[EP086|Pikachu Re-Volts]]''.

A Flareon was part of an exhibition in ''[[EP122|Flower Power]]''.

A Flareon appeared in {{Gary}}'s explanation in ''[[EP272|Johto Photo Finish]]''.

Flareon made a small cameo appearance in the opening sequence of ''[[M11|Giratina and the Sky Warrior]]'' together with an {{p|Eevee}} and its six other evolutions at the time.

A Flareon appeared in ''[[DP123|Old Rivals, New Tricks!]]'', under the ownership of a [[Pokémon Coordinator]] competing in the [[Sandalstraw Town]] [[Pokémon Contest]].

A {{pkmn|Performer}}'s Flareon appeared in a neon image in ''[[XY060|A Showcase Debut!]]''.

A Performer's Flareon appeared in a video in ''[[XY080|Performing with Fiery Charm!]]''.

A Flareon appeared in a fantasy in ''[[XY090|Tag Team Battle Inspiration!]]'', where {{an|Shauna}} imagined what [[Serena's Eevee]] could evolve into.

A Flareon appeared in ''[[XY095|Love Strikes! Eevee, Yikes!]]'', where a wild {{p|Quilladin}} tried to win its affections. However, it wasn't impressed and attacked with {{m|Flamethrower}} before walking off.

A Trainer's Flareon appeared in ''[[M20|I Choose You!]]''.

A Trainer's Flareon appeared in ''[[SM034|A Crowning Moment of Truth!]]'' where it was seen receiving the Wela Crown.

A Flareon will appear during a fantasy in [[SM065]].

==In the manga==
[[File:Pyro Flareon EToP.png|thumb|200px|Flareon in [[The Electric Tale of Pikachu]]]]
===In the Pokémon Adventures manga===
{{main|Vee}}
In ''[[PS019|Blame it on Eevee]]'', a mutated Eevee could switch between his evolved forms, one of which is a Flareon. {{adv|Red}} catches him and adds him to his team and names him Vee. Later using the [[Evolutionary stone|Fire, Water and Thunder stones]] of [[Vermilion City|Vermilion Harbor]], which were given to him by {{adv|Giovanni}}, to evolve and [[Devolution|devolve]] him freely and faster. Eventually, he lost the ability to devolve after permanently becoming an {{p|Espeon}}, but Red felt more content now that he'd been freed from the pain that [[Team Rocket]]'s experiments had dealt.

A Flaereon appeared in a fantasy of Yellow's about Pokémon that could evolve via [[Evolutionary stone|stone]], it appeared with an Eevee, Vaporeon and Jolteon in ''[[PS058|The Kindest Tentacruel]]''.

A Flareon appeared in ''[[PS448|Pleased as Punch With Parasect]]'', owned by a [[Kimono Girl]].

A Flareon appeared in a fantasy in the {{chap|X & Y}}.
{{-}}

==Trivia==
* Flareon shares its {{pkmn|category}} name with {{p|Charmeleon}}, {{p|Charizard}}, {{p|Moltres}}, and {{p|Infernape}}. They are all known as the Flame Pokémon.
* Flareon was designed by [[Motofumi Fujiwara]].<ref>https://twitter.com/atsuko_nishida/status/783643367523557376</ref>

===Origin===
It is most likely based on {{wp|fox}}es, due to its body shape and orange coloration, but it also has traits of {{wp|feline}}s. The fluffy mane and tail resemble a {{wp|Pomeranian dog}}, as well as a {{wp|lion}}'s mane.

====Name origin====
Flareon is a combination of ''flare'' and ''eon'' (an immeasurably long period of time, possibly referring to how long evolution takes naturally). ''Eon'' is a suffix all {{p|Eevee}} [[Eeveelution|evolutions]] share and was Eevee's English prototype name.

Booster is literally ''booster'', possibly referring to {{wp|rocket boosters}}, which propel things by combustion of fuel.
